description: Given a text in natural language with statements or arguments, a type of formal logic to use ('Propositional', 'FirstOrder' or 'Modal'), a belief set to be parsed, a list of queries to be tested, and the result of the queries processed by the Tweety logic library, interprets the result into a reasoned answer in natural language

parameters.name: input
parameters.description: The natural language text to analyse

parameters.name: logicType
parameters.description: The type of logic to use for conversion: available options are 'Propositional', 'FirstOrder' or 'Modal'

parameters.name: belief_set
parameters.description: The belief set on which the query will be run/tested, to be parsed for selected logic type

parameters.name: queries
parameters.description: The queries to test as formula strings to parse for selected logic type and run within the corresponding Tweety reasoner

parameters.name: tweety_result
parameters.description: The result of the queries run in Tweety
